The following is a list of the top [National Football
League](/wiki/National_Football_League "National Football League") (NFL)
[quarterbacks](/wiki/Quarterback "Quarterback") in wins. In the NFL, the
quarterback is the only position that is credited with records of wins and
losses.

Active quarterback [Tom Brady](/wiki/Tom_Brady "Tom Brady") holds the records
for most wins with 229, most regular season wins with 202, and most postseason
wins with 27, as of week 8 of the 2018 NFL season. Having played the entirety
of his career with the [New England Patriots](/wiki/New_England_Patriots "New
England Patriots"), each of Brady's win records also apply to wins with a
single team.

Among retired players, the record for most wins is held by [Peyton
Manning](/wiki/Peyton_Manning "Peyton Manning") with 200. In his final
professional game, Manning set the then-record for wins, surpassing [Brett
Favre](/wiki/Brett_Favre "Brett Favre") who retired with 199 wins. Other
previous record-holders include [John Elway](/wiki/John_Elway "John Elway")
(162), [Fran Tarkenton](/wiki/Fran_Tarkenton "Fran Tarkenton") (130), and
[Johnny Unitas](/wiki/Johnny_Unitas "Johnny Unitas") (124). [Otto
Graham](/wiki/Otto_Graham "Otto Graham") holds the record for the highest
winning percentage with a minimum of 35 wins at .788 (61 wins to 16 losses).

He finished his professional career (AAFC and NFL) with a 105–17–4 regular-season record (84.0% win rate). Graham took his team to the championship game in all ten of his professional seasons winning seven of them (4 AAFC and 3 NFL).[101]
